item.title: Nix - Build the same thing at any time

item.description: Nix gives us the ability to build Docker image with minimum deterministic by providing some solid mechanisms. Firstly, using Nix, we can specify exactly the version of each package and its dependencies, and keep it completely the same each time the package build happens.

item.title: Nix Flakes: Reproducible and Discoverable Nix Packages
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: A Flake is essentially a file system managed by a file named flake.nix that we can modify. Additionally, a flake.lock file is used to lock dependency versions.

item.title: Nix in Building Docker Images
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Nix is a powerful tool for building Docker images. It allows us to build Docker images in a deterministic way.

item.title: Nix is Faster Than Docker Build
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: As I mentioned in the Build the same thing at any time, Nix knows the exact content of packages and dependencies before builds.

item.title: Nix Shell: Isolated Development Environments
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Nix Shell is essentially a command provided by Nix that drops us into an isolated shell environment. In this environment, we can perform any operation without mutating the global state of the host machine’s system.

item.title: Pinning nixpkgs in Nix
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Pinning nixpkgs means you can choose the version of nixpkgs, and then all packages required for building your application and its dependencies are fetched from this nixpkgs version where the version of each package is specified and not changed over time.

item.title: Shadow Copies in Docker Builds
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: One more issue that comes from internet access of Docker build is Shadow copies aka redundant files that are not cleaned after new versions of packages are installed.
